did.repository: Temple University - Charles L. Blockson Afro-American Collection

bioghist.p: Tabb Bishop was a lobbyist with the Philadelphia-based consulting firm S. R. Wojdak & Associates, where he worked on issues related to Philadelphia city government until 2002. Prior to joining the firm, he served as executive director of the Philadelphia Delegation in the Pennsylvania House of Representatives and worked on several major policy initiatives involving economic development, public transportation, housing, education, and environmental justice. Bishop served as Deputy Chief of Staff at Temple University from 2002 to 2007. In 2007 he left Temple to assume the newly created position as director of public policy for Verizon Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers related to Tabb Bishop's work as a lobbyist for S.R. Wojdak Associates. The issues on which Bishop worked included housing, predatory lending, a proposed new football stadium, and a ban on sales of spray paint to minors. Materials in the collection include: reports and position statements; reference materials on issues; correspondence and memos; contact information, such as business cards, telephone directories, and lists of members of Mayor John Street's cabinet and various government committees; Bishop's appointment calendars for 1996 and 2001; receipts; a video, possibly of an interview with a journalist; and several artifacts.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
